summary: The document is a memorandum from 10 May 1960, addressing a payment discrepancy concerning Bivard G. Tichbora. It outlines the efforts to verify a $650.00 payment that Tichbora claimed not to have received, despite evidence showing the check had been processed and was held as a cancelled check by the Cover Division. The memorandum also notes attempts to communicate these findings to Tichbora.
key_findings: The document illustrates a bureaucratic process focused on payment verification and highlights challenges in communication.
It demonstrates the role of the Cover Division in monitoring and resolving financial transaction discrepancies.
This memorandum emphasizes the critical nature of meticulous record-keeping and proactive follow-up in administrative operations.
